brief_summary.textblock:
This trial was conducted in Europe. The aim of this trial was to compare the pharmacodynamic
      (the effect of the investigated drug on the body) response of insulin degludec (insulin 454)
      with insulin glargine at steady-state conditions in subjects with type 1 diabetes mellitus.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Insulin Degludec With Insulin Glargine in Subjects With Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Type 1 diabetes mellitus (as diagnosed clinically) and treated with insulin for at
             least 12 months

          -  Subject is considered to be generally healthy, except for the underlying diabetes
             mellitus and related morbidity (such as well controlled hypertension and
             dyslipidaemia) based on an assessment of medical history, physical examination and
             clinical laboratory data, as judged by the Investigator

          -  Body Mass Index (BMI) between 18.0 and 28.0 kg/m^2 (both inclusive)

          -  Glycosylated haemoglobin (HbA1c) below or equal to 10.0 % based on central laboratory
             results

          -  Subject with a daily basal insulin requirement of between  0.2 IU/kg/day and 0.6
             IU/kg/day will be allowed to participate in the trial. Current total daily treatment
             with insulin must be less than 1.2 U/kg/day

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Known or suspected allergy to trial product(s) or related products

          -  Subject who has participated in any other trials involving investigational products
             within 3 months preceding the start of dosing

          -  Subject who has donated any blood or plasma in the past month or in excess of 500 mL
             within the 12 weeks preceding screening

intervention.description: Once daily dosing administered subcutaneously (s.c., under the skin) followed by a clamp visit. The two treatment periods will be separated by a wash-out period where the subjects will resume their normal insulin treatment.

Once daily dosing administered subcutaneously (s.c., under the skin) followed by a clamp visit. The two treatment periods will be separated by a wash-out period where the subjects will resume their normal insulin treatment.

clinical_study.official_title: A Randomised, Single Centre, Double-blind, Two-Period Cross-over, Multiple Dose Trial Comparing the Pharmacodynamic Response of Insulin 454 With Insulin Glargine at Steady-State Conditions in Subjects With Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus

oversight_info.authority: Germany: Federal Institute for Drugs and Medical Devices

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the glucose infusion rate curve

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the serum insulin concentration curve  at steady state

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Pharmacokinetics/Dynamics Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Treatment
